lines.text:
[Joshua is about to execute Pahlevi]
Hey, do you believe in God?
Good. We'll wait ten seconds and see if he comes to save you.

When a child is six years old, it says, "the father can do everything". When he's twelve, he says, "the father can almost do everything". When he's sixteen, he says, "the father is an idiot". When he's twenty-four, he says, "the father wasn't maybe such an idiot", and then, when he's forty, he says, "if I could only ask my father". But I'm afraid my sons will never ask themselves that.
I haven't been to school in like, months.
It's boring. Rather be smoking bud in a museum. Let's go see the snakes.
[Joshua has returned home with Reuben. He faces his father for the first time in years]

[to Reuben]
Did you let him in?
[shrugs. Arkady slaps him, and Joshua punches his father in retaliation]
He gets what I got, is that it?
Get out of my house, or I swear to you, you get belt.

[brandishing his belt]
Get out of my house! Get OUT of my house!
I'll fucking kill you! You fucking lay a hand on me!
Get out, I said! Get out! Murderer! Out!
Then we'll meet later somewhere else.
Can't do that. I'm sorry. You look good, though. You're growing.
Mom's gonna die. She got a brain tumor.
Pop still work at the stand?
Be under the boardwalk. Near Nathan's, tomorrow at four.
C'mere. How'd you know I was here? I won't do anything, just tell me.
Nobody can know I'm here. Not your friends, not their relatives, nobody. Don't discuss it with Sacha or anybody else. Okay? See you tomorrow.
